author: dreid
msg: Start to add code that may (according to those who seem to care) help us to move
forward in our quest for the holy grail - limitless clean electricity! Just joking :-)
It's actually the first steps towards the infrastructure to create and manage the
long imagined projects.apache.org site.
So far there isn't much as you can see.
- at present I've used doap as that seemed to gain some form of
consensus as a good plan
- there is a very simple xsl
- there is a script that will create the html via the doap and xsl
into the (unimaginatively named) html directory.
- svn:ignore has been set for the generated html files
- a simple css file is included to make it look pretty
I think doap is a reasonable place to start, but I think we possibly want
to expand on it to allow extra information to be included. The mailing list
section should be expanded and we need more ways of describing the projects
so we can build a classification system that allows easier finding.
Hopefully this will allow others to now spring into life and build from here!
